name: recontact
content:
Add to word list

to communicate with someone again, for a second, third, etc. time, by calling or sending them a letter, email, etc.: After a year, the travel agent will re-contact individuals or groups previously contacted to solicit business. We will look into this issue for you and will recontact you later in the week.
More examplesFewer examplesTo increase sales, we re-contact prospects that have been called over the past 12 months.Researchers may be ethically obliged to re-contact participants and tell them what they know.We're building a database and will recontact all participants every two years.
